oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Maude in the kitchen at Grassmere
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Color photograph of Maude Morton Webb cleaning the floor in the indoor kitchen at Grassmere. She cooked and cleaned for the Croft sisters.

Frank Morton (1874-1962) came to work at Grassmere in 1913. He married Agnes Smith (app. 1874-1930) around 1895, and they raised their nine children together while they lived in a cabin on the property. Frank worked as a farm laborer on the site until his death. Albert Morton (1913-1973) was the fifth child of Frank and Agnes Morton. He lived on the property and worked for the Croft sisters after his father passed away.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: African Americans--Tennessee; Household employees;
Color photographs; Interiors; Kitchens
